supporting_quotes: Banerjee spent three years at Presidency, receiving a BSc (Honors) in Economics in 1981.
After completing his undergraduate studies, Banerjee pursued an MA in Economics at Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi
He completed his degree in 1983
Thesis: Essays on Information Economics (1988)
briefly served as a research assistant to Jeffrey Sachs
His dissertation research, supervised by Eric Maskin, was primarily theoretical
Institutions: Princeton University (1988-1992)
Institutions: Harvard University (1992-1993)

roles: Ford Foundation International Professor of Economics
supporting_quotes: Banerjee is currently the Ford Foundation International Professor of Economics at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology
Institutions: MIT (1993–present)
In 1994, he received a Sloan Research Fellowship, awarded annually to early career researchers with the 'potential to revolutionize their fields.'

organizations: Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab (J-PAL)
supporting_quotes: He is co-founder and co-director of the Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab (J-PAL)
Banerjee is a co-founder of Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab (along with economists Esther Duflo and Sendhil Mullainathan)

organizations: American Academy of Arts and Sciences
supporting_quotes: He was elected a fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences in 2004.
Institutions: NBER (2006–present)
In 2009, he received the Infosys Prize in the social sciences (economics) category.

roles: Honorable Mention recipient for Business Book
supporting_quotes: In 2012, he shared the Gerald Loeb Award Honorable Mention for Business Book with co-author Esther Duflo for their book Poor Economics.

roles: panel member for Millennium Development Goals update
supporting_quotes: In 2013, he was named by the United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon to a panel of experts tasked with updating the Millennium Development Goals after 2015

organizations: Kiel Institute for the World Economy
supporting_quotes: In 2014, he received the Bernhard-Harms-Prize from the Kiel Institute for the World Economy.
He served on the Social Sciences jury for the Infosys Prize in 2018.

roles: Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences laureate
supporting_quotes: In 2019, Banerjee shared the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences with Esther Duflo and Michael Kremer, 'for their experimental approach to alleviating global poverty.'
He was awarded the Doctor of Letters (Honoris Causa) by the University of Calcutta in January 2020.
Abhijit Banerjee and Esther Duflo received the Golden Plate Award of the American Academy of Achievement in September 2022.

organizations: UZH Faculty of Business, Economics, and Informatics
Lemann Center for Development, Education and Public Policy
supporting_quotes: In October 2025, the University of Zurich announced that Banerjee and Duflo would be joining the faculty of the UZH Faculty of Business, Economics, and Informatics in July 2026, where they would co-direct the newly-established Lemann Center for Development, Education and Public Policy.
Institutions: University of Zurich (2026–)
Banerjee is a fellow of the Econometric Society
a member of the National Academy of Sciences
He has also been a Guggenheim Fellow
In India he serves on the academic advisory board of Plaksha University, a science and technology university established in 2010.
Categories: Trustees of the British Museum
